page.title: 18Havenstreet railway
page.content: Seventy years ago the{Isle of Wight was served by a network of small branch lines which were owned by four main companies. By the 1960's the railways were in decline as a result of competition by road transport. The{last steam train}ran from Shanklin to Ryde in December 1966. However such was the affection for the old engines and carriages that a group of enthusiasts were determined to save them.{1.75 miles of track}between Havenstreet and Wootton were purchased and in 1971{Havenstreet Station}was re-opened to the public. In 1978 it was recognised as a fully-fledged working railway and has become an important{tourist attraction. The site at Havenstreet has been extended to include a{railway museum and works and several locomotives are undergoing restoration.
